page.title: 07Traditions in Warton
page.content: A market granted in 1200 A.D. has recently been revived. The flag of USA flies from the church tower every July 4th because Washington's family lived here. Their stars and stripes arms can be seen in the tower in stone. American visitors call often and "invaded" for the Bicentenary which was by far the greatest modern event here. Washington House still stands and is privately owned. The Hutton Charity of 1594 known as the Free Grammar School and Hospital of Jesus still functions. In the last 15 years his almshouses and school have been rebuilt, the latter by the County Council. A disused Institute is to become 2 more almshouses. Each child receives a Bible on completing Primary Education. An annual visit by Morris Dancers is a modern revival.
